page.title: 09GEOG.,ECOLOGY & ENVIRONMENT
page.content: Chorley is sited on a ridge of boulder clay at the foot of Anglezarke Moor. Land undulates slightly.The rock type is a mixture of shale and mill stone grit which is overlain by a peaty clay soil.The soils which are formed are quite fertile and can support arable farming which is a common feature of the study area. Much woodland of mixed deciduous trees,some coniferous areas. Birkacre is being redeveloped from grassland;oak and silver birch,and lodges into an amenities area.The rain- fall is approx 2000mm a year,climatic conditions,temperate.The type of land uses are residential with new develop- ments,industrial(small)Perrites rubber and plastics,employs l50.Communication with the rest of the country is governed by M6,M6l,Leeds/Liverpool canal and the branch line between Manchester and Preston.
